Description: Painted pottery shabti of Bakhapy(?) with blackening blue striated lappet wig with red-striped yellow terminals, blue and yellow banded collar, white body with red water-pots and basket on back, and red central square beneath wrists; red painted face with white eyes, black pupils and cosmetic lines; arms crossed in relief with hands red holding black (over red ?) painted hoes (not in relief); lower front and sides with four horizontal lines of black hieroglyphs against yellow background with red dividing lines, with narrower band without text below last; red central band at feet. Text gives part of chapter 6 of the Book of the Dead.
